# Edward Dierkes

}}
Edward B. Dierkes  (March 14, 1886 â€“ November 21, 1955) was an American amateur soccer player who competed in the 1904 Summer Olympics. In 1904 he was a member of the St. Rose Parish team, which won the bronze medal in the soccer tournament. He played in three of the four matches.
